heading: 1.4.1 .R Script
text:
.R files simple text files containing R code. used writing running R scripts, can include data analysis, data manipulation, plotting commands.Creating .R Script:
1. RStudio, go File > New File > R Script.Write R code script editor.Write R code script editor.Save file .R extension.Save file .R extension.

heading: 1.4.2 .Rmd Rmarkdown
text:
.Rmd (R Markdown) files used creating dynamic documents combine code, text, visualizations. ideal reports, presentations, reproducible research.Creating .Rmd Notebook:
1. RStudio, go File > New File > R Markdown.
2. Choose type output (e.g., HTML, PDF, Word).
3. Write code narrative text R Markdown editor.
4. Use R code chunks (``{r}) embed R code. 5. Click theKnit` button generate final document.

heading: 1.4.3 Numeric
text: Numeric variables store numbers can either integers doubles (floating-point numbers).

heading: 1.4.4 String
text: String variables store text data created enclosing text quotes.

heading: 1.5.1 Vector
text: Vectors one-dimensional arrays can hold numeric, string, logical data. created using c() function.

heading: 1.5.2 List
text: Lists versatile data structures can hold different types data, including lists.

heading: 1.5.3 Factor
text: Factors used represent categorical data useful statistical modeling.

heading: 1.5.4 Matrix
text: Matrices two-dimensional arrays hold numeric data. created using matrix() function.

heading: 1.5.5 DataFrame
text: DataFrames table-like structures can hold different types data columns, making ideal datasets.basics, able get started first R project, create different types files, understand fundamental data structures R.
